segment.source: What's New in AGPM 4.0 SP1
segment.target: What's New in AGPM 4.0 SP1

segment.source: What's New in AGPM 4.0 SP1
segment.target: What's New in AGPM 4.0 SP1

segment.source: What's New in AGPM 4.0 SP1
segment.target: What's New in AGPM 4.0 SP1

segment.source: This “What’s New” content describes enhancements and supported configurations for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) 4.0 SP1.
segment.target: This “What’s New” content describes enhancements and supported configurations for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) 4.0 SP1.

segment.source: If there is a difference between this content and other AGPM documentation, this content should be considered authoritative and should supersede the content included with this product.
segment.target: If there is a difference between this content and other AGPM documentation, this content should be considered authoritative and should supersede the content included with this product.

segment.source: What’s new
segment.target: What’s new

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP1 supports the following enhancements:
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP1 supports the following enhancements:

segment.source: New and changed client-side extensions
segment.target: New and changed client-side extensions

segment.source: Group Policy client-side extensions (CSEs) have been added or changed for AGPM to support new Group Policies in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: Group Policy client-side extensions (CSEs) have been added or changed for AGPM to support new Group Policies in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: These group policies enable Group Policy administrators to manage and track Windows 8-specific Group Policy settings that change between two Group Policy Objects (GPOs) or templates.
segment.target: These group policies enable Group Policy administrators to manage and track Windows 8-specific Group Policy settings that change between two Group Policy Objects (GPOs) or templates.

segment.source: You can also create custom GPOs, with Windows 8-specific settings, and configure and save the GPOs as a template.
segment.target: You can also create custom GPOs, with Windows 8-specific settings, and configure and save the GPOs as a template.

segment.source: To view your CSEs, use the settings and difference reports that are available in the AGPM 4.0 SP1 client.
segment.target: To view your CSEs, use the settings and difference reports that are available in the AGPM 4.0 SP1 client.

segment.source: The new and changed Group Policy client-side extensions are:
segment.target: The new and changed Group Policy client-side extensions are:

segment.source: Central Access Policy: Enables Group Policy administrators to specify Central Access Policies on Group Policy servers, for example, file servers.
segment.target: Central Access Policy: Enables Group Policy administrators to specify Central Access Policies on Group Policy servers, for example, file servers.

segment.source: Central Access Policy is an authorization policy that is specified by a GPO item and applied to policy targets to facilitate centralized access and control of resources.
segment.target: Central Access Policy is an authorization policy that is specified by a GPO item and applied to policy targets to facilitate centralized access and control of resources.

segment.source: These Central Access Policies must be configured on a Group Policy client computer from within Active Directory.
segment.target: These Central Access Policies must be configured on a Group Policy client computer from within Active Directory.

segment.source: A Group Policy distributes the knowledge of an applicable Central Access Policy to the computers that have to enforce it.
segment.target: A Group Policy distributes the knowledge of an applicable Central Access Policy to the computers that have to enforce it.

segment.source: Name Resolution Policy changes: Enables Group Policy administrators to configure settings for DNS security and DirectAccess on DNS client computers.
segment.target: Name Resolution Policy changes: Enables Group Policy administrators to configure settings for DNS security and DirectAccess on DNS client computers.

segment.source: New tabs for configuring Generic DNS Server settings and Encoding settings have been added.
segment.target: New tabs for configuring Generic DNS Server settings and Encoding settings have been added.

segment.source: Group Policy Preference changes: Adds support for the configuration and management of Internet Explorer 10 settings that were added for Windows 8.
segment.target: Group Policy Preference changes: Adds support for the configuration and management of Internet Explorer 10 settings that were added for Windows 8.

segment.source: Remote Application and Desktop Connections: Lets Group Policy administrators specify the default connection URL that is used for Remote Application and Desktop Connections.
segment.target: Remote Application and Desktop Connections: Lets Group Policy administrators specify the default connection URL that is used for Remote Application and Desktop Connections.

segment.source: Windows To Go Startup Options: Lets Group Policy administrators configure whether the computer will boot to Windows To Go if a USB device that contains a Windows To Go workspace is connected.
segment.target: Windows To Go Startup Options: Lets Group Policy administrators configure whether the computer will boot to Windows To Go if a USB device that contains a Windows To Go workspace is connected.

segment.source: Windows To Go Hibernate Options: Lets Group Policy administrators configure whether a computer can use the hibernation sleep state (S4) when the computer is started from a Windows To Go workspace.
segment.target: Windows To Go Hibernate Options: Lets Group Policy administrators configure whether a computer can use the hibernation sleep state (S4) when the computer is started from a Windows To Go workspace.

segment.source: Customer feedback and hotfix rollup
segment.target: Customer feedback and hotfix rollup

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP1 includes a rollup of fixes to address issues found since the AGPM 4.0 release.
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP1 includes a rollup of fixes to address issues found since the AGPM 4.0 release.

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP1 contains the latest fixes up to and including Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 Hotfix 1.
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP1 contains the latest fixes up to and including Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 Hotfix 1.

segment.source: Settings and difference reports show new Group Policy extensions
segment.target: Settings and difference reports show new Group Policy extensions

segment.source: The new Group Policy extensions have been added to the settings and difference reports.
segment.target: The new Group Policy extensions have been added to the settings and difference reports.

segment.source: Installer changes and support
segment.target: Installer changes and support

segment.source: The changes and support for the AGPM 4.0 SP1 installer are:
segment.target: The changes and support for the AGPM 4.0 SP1 installer are:

segment.source: If you install AGPM 4.0 SP1 on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012, the AGPM installer verifies that the required prerequisite software (Group Policy Management Console and the .NET 3.5 Framework) is installed.
segment.target: If you install AGPM 4.0 SP1 on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012, the AGPM installer verifies that the required prerequisite software (Group Policy Management Console and the .NET 3.5 Framework) is installed.

segment.source: If these prerequisites are not installed, the AGPM 4.0 SP1 installation is blocked.
segment.target: If these prerequisites are not installed, the AGPM 4.0 SP1 installation is blocked.

segment.source: When you install AGPM 4.0 SP1, WCF Activation, Non-HTTP Activation, and Windows Process Activation Service are automatically enabled.
segment.target: When you install AGPM 4.0 SP1, WCF Activation, Non-HTTP Activation, and Windows Process Activation Service are automatically enabled.

segment.source: On Windows Vista, Windows 7, and Windows 8 client operating systems, download the appropriate version of the Remote System Administration Toolkit for your operating system before you install AGPM 4.0 SP1.
segment.target: On Windows Vista, Windows 7, and Windows 8 client operating systems, download the appropriate version of the Remote System Administration Toolkit for your operating system before you install AGPM 4.0 SP1.

segment.source: Backward compatibility with older supported operating systems is supported.
segment.target: Backward compatibility with older supported operating systems is supported.

segment.source: Ability to upgrade or update to AGPM 4.0 SP1 without re-entering configuration parameters
segment.target: Ability to upgrade or update to AGPM 4.0 SP1 without re-entering configuration parameters

segment.source: You can upgrade the AGPM client or server to AGPM 4.0 SP1 only from AGPM 4.0 without being prompted to re-enter configuration parameters (called “Smart Upgrade”), as shown in the following table.
segment.target: You can upgrade the AGPM client or server to AGPM 4.0 SP1 only from AGPM 4.0 without being prompted to re-enter configuration parameters (called “Smart Upgrade”), as shown in the following table.

segment.source: If you are upgrading to AGPM 4.0 SP1 from other versions of AGPM, as shown in the table, you must use the “Classic Upgrade,” which requires you to re-enter the configuration parameters.
segment.target: If you are upgrading to AGPM 4.0 SP1 from other versions of AGPM, as shown in the table, you must use the “Classic Upgrade,” which requires you to re-enter the configuration parameters.

segment.source: Since each version of AGPM is associated with a particular operating system, refer to Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install, and be sure to upgrade your operating system as appropriate before performing an upgrade.
segment.target: Since each version of AGPM is associated with a particular operating system, refer to Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install, and be sure to upgrade your operating system as appropriate before performing an upgrade.

segment.source: Supported configurations
segment.target: Supported configurations

segment.source: AGPM supports the configurations in the following table.
segment.target: AGPM supports the configurations in the following table.

segment.source: Although AGPM supports mixed configurations, it is strongly recommended that you run the AGPM client and server on the same operating system family, for example, Windows 8 with Windows Server 2012, Windows 7 with Windows Server 2008 R2, and so on.
segment.target: Although AGPM supports mixed configurations, it is strongly recommended that you run the AGPM client and server on the same operating system family, for example, Windows 8 with Windows Server 2012, Windows 7 with Windows Server 2008 R2, and so on.
